description:
NGC2174 (aka Monkey Head Nebula) is located in the constellation Orion about 6,400 light-years away. NGC 2174 can be found with binoculars near the head of the Orion hunter during the winter and its size is larger than the full Moon. NGC 2174 is an H II emission nebula as well as a star-forming region surrounding loose open clusters of young stars.
This image is the Hubble color palette (SHO) plus the natural star color using R, G, and B filters.

Technical details:
Telescope: TEC 160FL + TEC FRC 0.9x
Mount: Astro-Physics Mach 2 GTO
Imaging cameras:ZWO ASI6200MM
Software: PHD2, PixInsight, Lightroom 6.4, Sequence Generator Pro, Photoshop CS6
Location: Palo Alto, California, USA
Total Integration: 32.9 Hours
PhotometricColorCalibration data(before crop):
Resolution ............... 0.783 arcsec/px
Rotation ................. 146.171 deg
Observation start time ... 2021-02-06 02:38:39 UTC
Observation end time ..... 2021-02-25 06:16:52 UTC
Focal distance ........... 990.02 mm
Pixel size ............... 3.76 um
Field of view ............ 2d 5' 1.6" x 1d 23' 24.2"
Image center ............. RA: 6 09 53.922 Dec: +20 33 09.96

Filters: Astrodon 50mm Unmounted LRGB Gen2 E-Series Filter Sets
Astrodon 50mm Unmounted 3nm Narrowband Ha, SII, OIII filters
Blue 22x120" 44 Minutes Bin1x1
Green 22x120" 44 Minutes Bin1x1
Red 22x120" 44 Minutes Bin1x1
Ha 45x900" 11.25 Hours Bin1x1
OIII 35x900" 8.75 Hours Bin1x1
SII 43x900" 10.75 Hours Bin1x1
title: NGC2174 (Monkey Head Nebula) SHO + RGB stars
